channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ethereum brushes record high after Fed Chair says ‘balance of risks’ is shifting
item.description: Investors interpreted Jerome Powell’s remarks as evidence for September rate cuts.

item.title: Why does an independent Fed matter? Just look at Ronald Reagan’s economy with Paul Volcker hiking rates to nearly 20%
item.description: Independent central banks can more easily take unpopular steps to fight inflation, such as raise interest rates, which makes borrowing more expensive.

item.title: Self-driving cars are officially coming to New York City
item.description: Waymo has the green light to start testing its self-driving cars in New York City. Mayor Eric Adams announced Friday that the city has granted Waymo a...

item.title: Reddit—and a dash of AI—do what Google and ChatGPT can’t

item.title: Waymo Gets First Permit to Test Autonomous Vehicles in New York City
item.description: The cars will have a trained specialist behind the wheel as Waymo starts testing them in parts of Manhattan and Brooklyn.

item.title: Winter is coming: U.S. will be most vulnerable to a recession late this year and early next as tariff and immigration fallout peak, top economist says
item.description: With the economy facing many threats, it wouldn’t take much to push it into recession, Mark Zandi warns.

item.title: Canva’s billionaire founders are minting overnight millionaires with employee share sale
item.description: Past and present “Canvanauts” will be able to sell up to $3 million of their vested equity, an internal email says.

item.title: Whole Foods settles class action lawsuit over hot cocoa packaging. Here’s how much you could get
item.description: Companies have several ways to increase their bottom lines. The first way is to raise the prices of products. But doing so can lead to fewer sales. In...

item.title: AI Is Making Marketing Great Again
item.description: Delegate marketing drudgery to AI and spend your time on the creative aspects.

item.title: Meet Milwaukee’s 15 Fastest-Growing Private Companies
item.description: These 15 companies from the Milwaukee metro area earned a spot on the 2025 Inc. 5000 list.

item.title: Dow soars more than 900 points after Fed hints at interest rate cuts
item.description: Wall Street is rallying on Friday toward its best day in months after the head of the Federal Reserve hinted the cuts to interest rates that investors...

item.title: Airbnb’s Joe Gebbia May Have a New Gig—in the White House
item.description: Gebbia, who previously worked with DOGE, is expected to be tapped as the nation’s first chief design officer.

item.title: The TikTok dorm water panic is officially here

item.title: Cracker Barrel’s first rebrand in nearly 50 years backfired. The company’s stock lost nearly $100 million after introducing a more minimalist look
item.description: The restaurant chain has gotten heat, accused of going too woke.

item.title: Google’s AI Mode Can Now Start Making Restaurant Reservations for Customers
item.description: The AI Mode from Google can help people find a table, but there’s still one key step it can’t take.
